label.text: Fuel to Minimise Carbon Dioxide
There are plans to build a new power plant in Zedland to convert heat energy into electrical energy.
Increased amounts of carbon dioxide (CO₂) in the atmosphere contribute to global warming.
The government in Zedland wants to choose a fuel for the new power plant that minimises the amount of CO₂ produced relative to the amount of electrical energy produced.
When a fuel burns, it chemically combines with oxygen, and heat energy is released. Common fuels used by power plants include coal, methane gas and diesel.
Coal is mostly carbon (along with water). When the carbon (C) in coal burns, CO₂ is produced, and energy is released (measured in joules).
C + O₂ → CO₂ + heat energy
When methane (CH₄) burns, CO₂ and water are produced, and heat energy is released.
CH₄ + 2O₂ → CO₂ + 2H₂O + heat energy
Diesel is a liquid made up of many types of hydrocarbons (molecules made up of hydrogen and carbon atoms). When diesel is burned, carbon dioxide and water are produced, and heat energy is released.
The efficiency of converting heat energy to electrical energy is the same for all fuels.
A particular load of coal is almost entirely carbon.
Which one of the following values is the closest estimate of the amount of CO₂ produced when 1 tonne of this coal is completely burned?
0.03 tonnes CO₂
0.3 tonnes CO₂
1 tonne CO₂
3 tonnes CO₂
What information will the government of Zedland need in order to determine which fuel will minimise the CO₂ produced by the power plant?
Select all correct answers.
the amount of heat energy produced per kilogram for each fuel
the cost per kilogram for each fuel
the mass of CO₂ produced per kilogram for each fuel that is burned
the mass per cubic metre for each fuel
the temperature at which each fuel burns
the amount of energy Zedland is expected to need

Methane gas can be sourced by drilling deep into the earth to access methane gas generated by prehistoric decomposition of living matter.
Methane is also produced by the decomposition of organic matter in landfills. If not collected, it escapes into the atmosphere.
If methane is used as a fuel source, which method of sourcing methane will minimise the release of carbon compounds into the atmosphere?
drilling for methane
collecting methane from landfills
The method used does not make a difference.
